intro: Cyathula prostrata var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyathula, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its unique floral structures called cyathia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, while the flowers are small and clustered in cup-like formations. This variety is distinguished by its narrower leaf shape compared to other variants of Cyathula prostrata.
